title: 来看看我们Mojang的新网站——BLOCK BY BLOCK
author: cc7w
txt_content:
本帖最后由 1345979462 于 2016-6-28 19:10 编辑 

    你可能已经听说过了,Minecraft是一个很酷,很有趣,同时也很受欢迎的游戏。我们可以停在这里看看，并为自己感到骄傲。

    但我们Mojang也相信Minecraft是一个好东西——不仅仅是一个鼓舞人心的,令人愉快的,消遣时光的游戏[这语言有毒？]，
    同时，它也是一个给人们带来真实感，正改变全世界人们的生活的游戏。
    这就是为什么我们鼓励Minecraft使用 一个教育工具 和我们为什么设立 BLOCK BY BLOCK 的原因了。
    BLOCK BY BLOCK是一个和联合国人居署合作，使用Minecraft作为一种参与发展中的公共的社区交流的方式，允许当地人控制它们的环境。
    




    公共场合非常的重要。它们是任何社区的支柱，是它健康度的重要衡量指标。它们是城市基础设施——水利、能源、交通的关键部分，而合理规划的公共空间，可以提升公民的身份感、社会感和安全感。
    但是在贫穷的地方，由于冲突或者快速的城市化进程，这些必要的空间往往在建设中会半途而废。这些重要的设施被忽视，
    公民的权利得不到保障。[表示翻译出来这一段还是不明觉厉]






    联合国人居署和Mojang致力于在我们能到的地方扭转这种问题。同时 Minecraft 证明了一个发展环境的一个宝贵的沟通建议。
    当地人在这些挑战中反馈建议给城市规划者。没人知道一个社区除了人民的生活，什么更重要。同时在Minecraft中，他们被
    给予了一个简单又快速的方法去释放它们的想法。






    迄今为止，Block And Block 已经在18个不同的地区，13个不同的国家开展。2016年现在加入的地区和国家也越来越多。在我
    们的 新网页 看看吧，你能看到我们已经做完工作的地区 ----- 像内罗毕、孟买、科索沃和墨西哥城。



    然后，如果你有条件，请  捐赠 。
    <3
    Marsh

    原帖地址 http://mojang.com/2016/06/check- ... for-block-by-block/





红字部分请大神润色。此处折叠为原文。
CHECK OUT OUR NEW SITE FOR BLOCK BY BLOCK! Posted on Jun 23, 2016 by Marsh Davies  You might have heard this already, but Minecraft is a pretty cool, fun, popular game. We could have just stopped there and felt reasonably proud of ourselves. But we at Mojang also passionately believe that Minecraft is a Good Thing - not just an inspiring, delightful, mind-expanding pastime, but something that brings real, positive change to people’s lives the world over. That’s why we encourage Minecraft’s use as an educational tool and it’s also why we set up Block by Block - a partnership with UN-Habitat which uses Minecraft as a way of engaging communities in the development of public space, allowing locals to take control of their environment.  Public spaces are super important. They’re the backbone of any community and a vital measure of its health. They’re a key part of urban infrastructure - water, energy and communication - and well-planned public space promotes civic identity, socialisation and security. But in places of poverty, conflict or rapid urbanisation, these essential spaces often fall by the wayside, important amenities are overlooked and locals are disenfranchised.  UN-Habitat and Mojang are committed to reversing this where we can - and Minecraft has proved an invaluable way of communicating proposals to develop the environment, engaging locals in these challenges and taking their feedback to city planners. Nobody knows what a community needs better than those who live in it, and with Minecraft they’re given an easy and rapid way to express their ideas.  So far, Block by Block has initiated projects in 18 locations across 13 different countries, with many more underway in 2016. Have a look at our newly re-launched website to see the work we’ve done in places like Nairobi, Mumbai, Kosovo and Mexico City.  And, if you can, donate.  <3  Marsh - @marshdavies
